definitions.definition: Having the form of a line ; straight or roughly straight; following a direct course.
Made, or designed to be used, in a step-by-step , sequential manner.
Long and narrow, with nearly parallel sides.

subdefinitions.definition: Having degree one; that is, being of the form a 1 x 1 + a 2 x 2 + ⋯ + a n x n + b {\displaystyle a_{1}x_{1}+a_{2}x_{2}+\cdots +a_{n}x_{n}+b} , where each x i {\displaystyle x_{i}} is a variable . See also Linear polynomials on  Wikipedia. Wikipedia
examples: 4 x + 5 y + 1 2 z {\displaystyle 4x+5y+{\frac {1}{2}}z} is a linear polynomial, but 4 x y + 1 2 z {\displaystyle 4xy+{\frac {1}{2}}z} and 4 x + z 2 {\displaystyle 4x+z^{2}} are not.

subdefinitions.definition: Involving only linear polynomials. See also Linear equation on  Wikipedia. Wikipedia
examples: The graph of the linear equation y = a x + b {\displaystyle y=ax+b} is a straight line with slope a {\displaystyle a} and y-intercept b {\displaystyle b}

subdefinitions.definition: An additive , homogeneous mapping ; that is, a function f : V → W {\displaystyle f:V\to W} is linear if it distributes over vector addition ( f ( v + w ) = f ( v ) + f ( w ) {\displaystyle f(\mathbf {v} +\mathbf {w} )=f(\mathbf {v} )+f(\mathbf {w} )} ) and respects scalar multiplication ( f ( c v ) = c f ( v ) {\displaystyle f(c\mathbf {v} )=cf(\mathbf {v} )} ). If V {\displaystyle V} and W {\displaystyle W} are vector spaces over a field K {\displaystyle K} , f {\displaystyle f} may also be called a K {\displaystyle K} -linear map. See also linear map on  Wikipedia. Wikipedia
examples: The map f : R 3 → R 2 {\displaystyle f:\mathbb {R} ^{3}\to \mathbb {R} ^{2}} taking ( x , y , z ) ↦ ( x + y + z , x − y + 3 z ) {\displaystyle (x,y,z)\mapsto (x+y+z,x-y+3z)} is a linear map.
labels: of a function between vector spaces
subdefinitions.label_groups: of a function between vector spaces

subdefinitions.definition: A module homomorphism ; that is, a group homomorphism that commutes with scalar multiplication. See also Module homomorphism on  Wikipedia. Wikipedia
labels: of a function over a module
subdefinitions.label_groups: of a function over a module

definitions.definition: A type of length measurement involving only one spatial dimension ( as opposed to area or volume ) .
Delivered or delivering on a fixed schedule, as opposed to on-demand .
examples: linear TV , linear content, linear video, linear radio
Linear television is dead or, at least, declining.
Linear television includes traditional over-the-air broadcasting, as well as much cable and satellite broadcasting.

main_definition: Having the form of a line ; straight or roughly straight; following a direct course.
secondary_definitions: Made, or designed to be used, in a step-by-step , sequential manner.
( botany , of leaves ) Long and narrow, with nearly parallel sides.
( mathematics ) ( of polynomials or polynomial equations )
( physics ) A type of length measurement involving only one spatial dimension ( as opposed to area or volume ) .
( Discuss this sense) ( media , of video and audio ) Delivered or delivering on a fixed schedule, as opposed to on-demand . [From 1980s]
